remarks: Deduce a group from its properties. ` N ` (negative) is normally dependent on ` x ` i.e. read it as ` N ( x ) ` .  Note: normally we don't use a ` ph ` antecedent on hypotheses that name structure components, since they can be eliminated with ~ eqid , but we make an exception for theorems such as ~ isgrpd2 , ~ ismndd , and ~ islmodd since theorems using them often rewrite the structure components. (Contributed by NM, 10-Aug-2013.)
statement:
isgrpd2.b $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` G ) ) $.
isgrpd2.p $e |- ( ph -> .+ = ( +g ` G ) ) $.
isgrpd2.z $e |- ( ph -> .0. = ( 0g ` G ) ) $.
isgrpd2.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. Mnd ) $.
isgrpd2.n $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> N e. B ) $.
isgrpd2.j $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. B ) -> ( N .+ x ) = .0. ) $.
isgrpd2 $p |- ( ph -> G e. Grp ) $.
$d .+ x $.
$d B x $.
$d G x $.
$d ph x $.
